content: The ACCDB format is similar to the MDB format it replaced. However, the ACCDB format supports additional functionality, such as:
The ability to store file attachments and other binary data
Integration with Microsoft Outlook and SharePoint

description: A file with .accdb extension is a Microsoft Access 2007 database file that stores users data in tables. It supports storing custom forms, SQL queries, and other data. ACCDB files replaced MDB files after Microsoft shifted to XML based file structure. ACCDB files can still be converted to MDB with old compatibility. However, the ACCDB are the widely used Access database file format now. Microsoft also supported additional features in ACCDB format such as possibility of storing file attachments, binary data, and multi-valued field support.

An ACCDB file is a database created by Microsoft Access 2007 or later. It typically contains data organized into tables and fields and may also include custom forms, SQL queries, and other data. The ACCDB format replaced Microsoft Access's previous database format, .MDB.

instructions: Windows users can open ACCDB files in Microsoft Access. Access 2007 and later versions can open ACCDB files. Mac users can open ACCDB files in MDB Viewer. MDB Viewer supports ACCDB files created by Access 2007, 2010, and 2013.
